quizInfo.Subject: Information Management
quizInfo.Title: Full Course Review
References: Any external links/handouts should be referenced here

quizData.question: Current Affairs: What is the famous quote of the infamous Alice Guo during her Senate Hearing on her questionable nationality and alleged ties with the Chinese Military and the POGO Hub in Bamban, Tarlac?
quizData.answer: Your honor, di ko na po maalala.
choices: Your honor, di ko na po maalala.
Your honor, kinalimutan ko na po sya.
Your honor, I think mahal na kita.
Your honor, sarap mong hampasin ng pala.

quizData.question: They are raw facts, that have not yet been processed to reveal their meaning to the end user.
It is the result of processing raw data to reveal its meaning.
It consists of transformed data and facilities decision making.
It is a shared, integrated computer structure that houses a collection of End-user data and Metadata.
It is a collection of programs that manages the dabase structure and controls access to the data stored in the database.
It serves as the intermediary between the user and the database.
The database structure itself is stored as a collection of files, and the only way to access the data in those files is through the _____.

What advantage of DBMS is in the statement?
The DBMS serves as the intermediary between the user and the database.

What advantage of DBMS is in the statement?
The database structure itself is stored as a collection of files, and the only way to access the data in those files is through the DBMS.

What advantage of DBMS is in the statement?
The more users access the data, the greater risks of data breaches.

What advantage of DBMS is in the statement?
Corporations invest considerable amounts of time, effort, and money to ensure that corporate data is used properly.

What advantage of DBMS is in the statement?
A DMBS provides a framework for better enforcement of data privacy.

What advantage of DBMS is in the statement?
Wider Access to well-managed data promotes a view of the organization's operations and a clearer view of the big picture.

What advantage of DBMS is in the statement?
It becomes much easier to see how actions in one segment of the company affect other segments.

What advantage of DBMS is in the statement?
Data inconsistency exist when different versions of the same data appear in the different places.

What advantage of DBMS is in the statement?
The DMBS makes it possible to produce quick answers to ad hoc queries.

What advantage of DBMS is in the statement?
From a database perspective, a query is a specific request issued to the DBMS for data manipulation -- for example, to read or update the data.

What advantage of DBMS is in the statement?
Better-managed data and improved data access make it possible to generate better-quality information, on which better decisions are based.

What advantage of DBMS is in the statement?
The quality of the information generated depends on the quality of the underlying data.

What advantage of DBMS is in the statement?
The availability of data, combined with the tools that transform data into usable information, empowers end users to make quick, informed decisions that can make the difference between success and failure in the global economy.
DBMS can be to build only one specific type of database.
The number of user determines whether the database is classified as single user or multiuser.
A type of database that supports only one user at a time.
A single user database that runs on a personal computer.
A type of database that supports multiple users at the same time.
A type of database that supports a relatively small number of users or a specific department within an organization.
A type of database that is used by the entire organization and supports many users across many departments.
A type of database that supports data located a single site.
A type of database that is created and maintained using storage services, such as Microsoft Azure or Amazon AWS.
A type of database that contains a wide variety of data used in multiple disciplines.
A type of database that supports data division across several different sites.
A type of database that contains data focused on particular subject areas.
A type of database designed primarily to support a company's day-to-day functioning.
A type of database focused primarily on storing historical data and business metrics used for tactical or strategic desicion making.
It refers to the activities that focus on the blueprint of database structure that will be used to store and manage end-user data.
A database that meets all user requirements always happen.
Database structure must be designed carefully.
This is such as crucial aspect of working with databases that most of this book is dedicated to the development of good database representation techniques.
Database design always get the attention it deserves.
Database design does not get the attention it deserves due to some changes occurring throughout the development cycle.
Database design does not get the attention it deserves due to poor logical data modeling.
Database design does not get the attention it deserves due to sufficient specification.
Database design does not get the attention it deserves because the design is assign to , or performed by mediocre.
Database design does not get the attention it deserves due to not enough of time in the development schedule.
What should be the first step in constructing a physical database?
quizData.answer: Transforming the logical design using the best practices.
choices: Transforming the logical design using the best practices.
Implementing the database without a design.

quizData.question: What does the transformation of a logical design into a physical database include?
quizData.answer: Transforming entities into tables, attributes into columns, domains into data types and constraints, and relationships into primary and foreign keys.
choices: Transforming entities into tables, attributes into columns, domains into data types and constraints, and relationships into primary and foreign keys.

quizData.question: What are domains transformed into during the construction of a physical database?
One of the best practice in transforming the logical design includes transforming relationships into primary and foreign keys.
What method improved data organization and management over the manual system?
How long did the file system method serve its purpose in data management?
What are the two major purposes of critiquing the file system method?
quizData.answer: Understanding the shortcomings of the file system to understand the development of modern databases, and recognizing that many problems aren’t unique to file systems
choices: Understanding the advantages of the file system and recognizing unique problems to file systems
Understanding the shortcomings of the file system to understand the development of modern databases, and recognizing that many problems aren’t unique to file systems
Understanding the advantages of the file system and recognizing that many problems are unique to file systems
Understanding the shortcomings of the file system and recognizing unique problems to file systems

quizData.question: What could lead to the duplication of problems in a database environment
quizData.answer: Failure to understand problems that are not unique to file systems.
choices: Failure to understand problems that are not unique to file systems.
Failure to understand problems that are unique to file systems
Understanding the shortcomings of the file system
Understanding the development of modern databases

quizData.question:
What problem associated with file systems in the statement?
Even the simplest data-retrieval task requires extensive programming.

What problem associated with file systems in the statement?
Programmers had to specify what must be done and how to do it with the older file systems.

What problem associated with file systems in the statement?
Modern databases use a nonprocedural data manipulation language that allows the user to specify what must be done without specifying how.

What problem associated with file systems in the statement?
The need to write programs to produce even the simplest reports makes ad hoc queries impossible.

What problem associated with file systems in the statement?
System becomes more difficult to manage as the number of files in the system expands.
choices: Lack of security and limited data sharing

quizData.question:
What problem associated with file systems in the statement?
Even a simple file system with a few files requires creating and maintaining several file management programs.
choices: Lack of security and limited data sharing

quizData.question:
What problem associated with file systems in the statement?
Partitioning data among multiple geographically dispersed users introduces a log of data security risks.
quizData.answer: Lack of security and limited data sharing
choices: Lack of security and limited data sharing

quizData.question:
What problem associated with file systems in the statement?
Making changes to an existing file structure can be difficult in a file system environment.
choices: Lack of security and limited data sharing

quizData.question: A data charateristic in which a change in the database schema affects a data access, thus requiring changes in all access programs.
A data characteristic in which changes in the database schema do not affect data access.
A data condition in which data representation and manipulation are reliant on the physical data storage characteristics.
A condition in which data access is unaffected by changes in the phyusical data storage characteristics.
It exist when the same data is stored unnecessarily at different places.
Having multiple copies of data increases the chances for a copy of the data to be susceptible to unauthorized access.
More likely to occur when complex entries are made in several different files or recur frequently in one or more files.

It is possible to enter a nonexistent sales agent's name and phone number into the Customer file, but customer's are not likely to be impressed if the insurance agency supplies the name and phone of an agent who does not exist.
A data malfunction in which inconsistent changes have been made to a database.
Develop when not all of the required changes in the redundant data are made successfully.
Raw facts of interest to the end user.
It is a data about data, through which the end-user data is integrated and managed.
Focuses on how the database structure will be used to store and manage end-user data.
This refers on the process of creating a specific data model for a determined problem domain.
This refers to the first step in designing a database.
This refers to a relatively simple representation that is usually graphical.
This refers to a representation of more complex real-world data structures.
This refers to an abstraction of a more complex real-world object or event.
Data models can facilitate interaction among the designer, the applications programmer, and the end user.
A well-developed data model can even foster improved understanding of the organization for which the database design is developed.
The importance of data modeling cannot be understated.
__________ constitutes the most basic information used by a system.
__________ are created to manage data and to help transform data into information.
Data is viewed the same ways by different people.
The following are the basic building blocks for data model EXCEPT ONE.
This data model basic building block refers to a person, place, thing, or event about which data will be collected and stored.
This data model basic building block refers to a characteristic of an entity.
This data model basic building block refers to an association among entitites.
These are the three types of relationships EXCEPT ONE.
This data model was developed in the 1960s to manage large amounts of data for complex manufacturing projects.
This data model was created to represent complex data relationships more effectively than the hierarchical model in order to improve database performance, and to impose a database standard.
This data model was introduced in 1970 by E.F. Codd of IBM.
This data model was introduced in 1976 by Peter Chen.
This data model's basic logical structure is represented by an upside-down tree that contains levels, or segments.
This data model's segment is the equivalent of a file system's record type.
This data model is generally used today.
This data model represented a major breakthrough for both users and designers.
This data model uses a foundatinal mathematical concept known as a relation.
This data model's graphical representation of entitites and their relationships in a database structure complemented the relational data model concepts.
This standard database concept of a network model refer to the conceptual organization of the entire database as viewed by the database administrator.
This standard database concept of a network model defines the portion of the database by the application programs that actually produce the desired information from the data in the database.
This standard database concept of a network model defines the environment in which data can be managed.
This standard database concept of a network model allows the database administrator to define the schema components.
Increasingly complex real-world problems demonstrated a need for a data model that more closely represented the real world.
In this data model, both data and its relationships are contained in a single structure known as an object.
What does OODBMS mean? It is which the Object-Oriented Data Model is the basis of.
This component of OODBM says that an object is an abstraction of a real-world entity.
This component of OODBM says that an attribute is the properties of a class.
This component of OODBM says that objects share similar characteristics are grouped in classes.
This component of OODBM says that a class is a collection of similar objects with shared structure and behavior.
This component of OODBM says that class are organized in an object hierarchy.
This component of OODBM says that a class hierarchy resembles a downright up tree in which each class has only one parent.
This component of OODBM says that inheritance is the ability of an object within the class hierarchy to inherit attribute.
This component of OODBM says that Object-Oriented Data Models are typically depicted using Unified Modeling Language (UML) class diagrams.
This is a metalanguage used to represent and manipulate data elements and permits the manipulation of a document's data elements.
Unlike other markup languages, XML permits the manipulation of a document's data elements.
It refers to a movement to find new and better ways to manage large amounts of web and sensor-generated data.
The term 'Big Data' have been first used in a computing framework by ____________ who is a Silicon Graphics scientist in the 1990s.
____________ first described the basic characteristics of Big Data databases.
The following are the characteristics of Big Data databases EXCEPT ONE.
This characteristic of a Big Data Database refers to the amount of data being stored.
This characteristic of a Big Data Database refers to the speed with which data grows and the need to process this data quickly in order to generate information and insight.
This characteristic refers to the fact that the data being collected comes in multiple data formats.
This is a large-scale distributed database system that stores structured and unstructured data in efficient ways.
This characteristic of a NoSQL database entails that they are not based on the relational model and SQL, hence the name NoSQL.
This characteristic of a NoSQL database entails that it doesn't support distributed database architectures.
This characteristic of a NoSQL database entails that it provides high scalability, availability, and fault tolerance.
This characteristic of a NoSQL database entails that it doesn't support large amounts of sparse data.
This characteristic of a NoSQL database entails that it is geared toward performance rather than transaction consistency.
One of the big advantages of NoSQL databases is that they generally use a _____________ database node.
NoSQL databases can handle very high volumes of data and is suited for ___________ data.
NoSQL databases are designed to support ________ operations.
One of the biggest problems of very large distributed databases are enforcing _______________.
Distributed databases automatically make copies of data elements at ____________________ to ensure high availability and fault tolerance.
This institute defined a framework for data modeling based on degrees of data abstraction in the early 1970s.
quizData.answer: American National Standards Institute Standards Planning and Requirements Committee
choices: American National Standards Institute Standards Planning and Requirements Committee
American Institute for Standards Planning and Requirements Committee
American National Institute for Standards Planning and Committee of Requirements
American Committee for National Standards and Planning Institute

quizData.question: These are the three levels of data abstraction as defined by the resulting ANSI/SPARC architecture EXCEPT ONE.
This level of data abstraction is the end user's view of the data environment.
This level of data abstraction refers to people who use the application programs to manipulate the data and generate information.
This schema of a level of data abstraction is a specific representation of its external model, using the database constructs supported by the chosen database.
This level of data abstraction represents a global view of the entire database by the entire organization.
This schema of level of data abstraction is the basis for the identification and high-level description of the main data objects.
This level of data abstraction is the representation of the database a seen by the DBMS.
This level of data abstraction requires the designer to match the conceptual model's characteristics and constraints to those of the selected implementation model.
This schema of a level of data abstraction is a specific representation of its model, using the database constructs supported by the chosen database.
This level of data abstraction operates at the lowest level, describing the way data is saved on storage media such as magnetic, solid state, or optical media.

This level of data abstraction requires the definition of both real-world storage devices and access ethods required to reach the data within those storage devices, making it both software and hardware dependent.
Who introduced the relational model and when?
What mathematical theories is the relational model based on?
What is predicate logic used for in the relational model?
quizData.answer: To provide a framework in which an assertion can be verified as either true or false.
choices: To provide a framework in which an assertion can be verified as either true or false.

quizData.question: What does set theory deal with?
quizData.answer: Sets, or groups of things, and is used as the basis for data manipulation in the relational model.
choices: Sets, or groups of things, and is used as the basis for data manipulation in the relational model.

quizData.question: How many components does the relational model have?
Which of the following is NOT a component of the relational model?
choices: A logical data structure represented by relations
A set of integrity rules to enforce data consistency
A set of operations that defines how data is manipulated

quizData.question: What is a table in the relational model also known as?
What does a row in a table represent?
What is a column in a table referred to as?
What must all values in a column conform to?
What is the specific range of values for a column known as?
What does the intersection of a row and column represent?
What is an attribute or group of attributes that determines the values of other attributes?
What does the term 'functional dependence' mean?
quizData.answer: The value of one or more attributes determines the value of one or more other attributes.
choices: The value of one or more attributes determines the value of one or more other attributes.
The ability to uniquely identify a row

quizData.question: What is a composite key?
quizData.answer: A key that is composed of more than one attribute.
choices: A key that consists of a single attribute
A key that is composed of more than one attribute.
A foreign key in another table
A secondary key used for indexing

quizData.question: Which key uniquely identifies any row in the table?
What is the primary key?
quizData.answer: A candidate key selected to uniquely identify all other attribute values in any given row.
choices: A superkey without any unnecessary attributes
A candidate key selected to uniquely identify all other attribute values in any given row.
A key used to relate two tables

quizData.question: What is a foreign key?
quizData.answer: An attribute or combination of attributes in one table whose values must either match the primary key in another table or be null.
choices: A key that uniquely identifies any row in the table
An attribute or combination of attributes in one table whose values must either match the primary key in another table or be null.
A candidate key selected to uniquely identify all other attribute values in any given row.
A key used strictly for data retrieval purposes

quizData.question: What is an example of a candidate key?
What is the purpose of the entity integrity rule?
quizData.answer: To ensure that each row in a table has its own unique identity.
choices: To ensure that each row in a table has its own unique identity.
To allow multiple null entries in a primary key
To allow duplicate primary key values
To ensure proper indexing of rows

quizData.question: What is referential integrity?
quizData.answer: A condition in which every reference to an entity instance by another entity instance is valid.
choices: A condition in which all primary keys are unique
A condition in which all data entries are non-null
A condition in which every reference to an entity instance by another entity instance is valid.
A condition in which all tables are normalized

quizData.question: Which integrity rule ensures that no invoice can have a duplicate number nor be null?
Which key can contain null entries?
What is relational algebra?
quizData.answer: A set of mathematical principles that form the basis for manipulating relational table contents.
choices: A set of mathematical principles that form the basis for manipulating relational table contents.

quizData.question: What is the term for using relational algebra operators on existing relations to produce new relations?
What is another term for the condition to be evaluated in relational algebra?
What does the SELECT operator (σ) do in relational algebra?
What is the symbol for the PROJECT operator in relational algebra?
What does the PROJECT operator (π) do in relational algebra?
What is the symbol for the UNION operator in relational algebra?
What does the UNION operator (∪) do?
quizData.answer: Merges two union-compatible tables into a new table, dropping the duplicate rows.
choices: Retrieves rows that are common to two tables.
Retrieves rows from one table not found in another table.
Merges two union-compatible tables into a new table, dropping the duplicate rows.
Retrieves possible pairs of rows from two tables.

quizData.question: What is the INTERSECT operator (∩) used for?
quizData.answer: Retrieves rows that are common to two union-compatible tables.
choices: Retrieves rows that are common to two union-compatible tables.
Retrieves rows from one table not found in another table.
Retrieves possible pairs of rows from two tables.

quizData.question: What does the DIFFERENCE operator (−) do?
quizData.answer: Retrieves rows from one table that are not found in another union-compatible table.
choices: Retrieves rows that are common to two tables.
Retrieves rows from one table that are not found in another union-compatible table.
Retrieves possible pairs of rows from two tables.

quizData.question: What does the PRODUCT operator (×) do?
quizData.answer: Retrieves possible pairs of rows from two tables (Cartesian product).
choices: Retrieves rows from one table that are not found in another table.
Retrieves rows that are common to two tables.
Retrieves possible pairs of rows from two tables (Cartesian product).

quizData.question: What is the symbol for the JOIN operator in relational algebra?
What does the JOIN operator (⋈) do?
quizData.answer: Retrieves rows from two tables based on criteria.
choices: Retrieves rows from two tables based on criteria.
Retrieves rows from one table not found in another table.
Retrieves possible pairs of rows from two tables.

quizData.question: What does the DIVIDE operator (÷) do?
choices: Retrieves rows from two tables based on criteria.
Retrieves rows from one table not found in another table.

quizData.question: What is the Entity Relationship Model (ERM)?
quizData.answer: A data model that describes relationships among entities at the conceptual level with the help of ER diagrams.
choices: A diagram for representing relational databases
A data model that describes relationships among entities at the conceptual level with the help of ER diagrams.

quizData.question: What does an Entity Relationship Diagram (ERD) depict?
quizData.answer: Entities, attributes, and relations in an entity relationship model.
choices: Entities, attributes, and relations in an entity relationship model.

quizData.question: In an ERD, what does a rectangle or entity box represent?
What is an entity instance or entity occurrence?
quizData.answer: Each row in the relational table.
choices: A row in the relational table

quizData.question: What is the term for a collection of similar entities?
What describes associations among data in an ERD?
What type of relationship notation uses diamonds connected to entities?
What type of relationship notation uses symbols at either end to describe cardinality?
In Chen Notation, how are attributes represented?
quizData.answer: By ovals connected to the entity rectangle with a line.
choices: By rectangles below the entity box
By diamonds connected to the entity rectangle
By ovals connected to the entity rectangle with a line
By lines connecting to other attributes

quizData.question: What is unnormalized data?
quizData.answer: Raw data in its original state that might contain redundant, multivalued, or anomalied data.
choices: Data that has been through the first normal form
Data that has been properly indexed
Raw data in its original state that might contain redundant, multivalued, or anomalied data.
Data that is in third normal form

quizData.question: What is the process of normalization?
quizData.answer: Assigning attributes to entities so that data redundancies are reduced or eliminated.
choices: Assigning attributes to entities so that data redundancies are reduced or eliminated.

quizData.question: What is the goal of the First Normal Form (1NF)?
quizData.answer: There are no repeating groups and the primary key is identified.
choices: There are no repeating groups and the primary key is identified.
All columns depend on the table's primary key.
No non-key attributes are determined by another non-key attribute.
Every determinant is a candidate key.

quizData.question: What is the requirement for Second Normal Form (2NF)?
quizData.answer: 1NF and all the columns depend on the table’s primary key.
choices: 1NF and all the columns depend on the table’s primary key.
Every determinant is a candidate key.

quizData.question: What is Boyce-Codd Normal Form (BCNF)?
quizData.answer: Every determinant is a candidate key.
choices: No repeating groups and the primary key is identified.
All columns depend on the table’s primary key.
Every determinant is a candidate key.
There are no non-key attributes determined by another non-key attribute.

quizData.question: What is a specific request for data manipulation issued by the end-user or the application to the DBMS?
What does SQL stand for?
How is SQL pronounced?

What category of SQL data types does float, real belong to?
What category of SQL data types does date, datetime, time belong to?
What category of SQL data types does char, text, varchar belong to?
What category of SQL data types does nchar, ntext, nvarchar belong to?
What category of SQL data types does binary, image, varbinary belong to?

What category of SQL operators does '+=, -=, *=, /=, %=' belong to?
What category of SQL operators does 'AND, OR, NOT, LIKE, IN, BETWEEN, EXISTS, ANY, ALL' belong to?
What is the SQL command to create a new database with a specific name?
What is the SQL command used to create a new database?
What is the SQL command to create a new database named ‘myDB’?
What is the SQL command used to delete an existing database?
What is the SQL command to create a new table with specific columns and data types?
What is the SQL command used to delete an existing table?
What is the SQL command to delete a specific table?
What is the SQL command to delete a table named ‘Students’?
What is the SQL command to delete only the data in the ‘Students’ table?
What is the SQL command used to add, delete, or modify columns in an existing table?
What is the SQL command to add a column to a specific table?
quizData.answer: ALTER TABLE table_name ADD column datatype;
choices: ALTER TABLE table_name ADD column datatype;

quizData.question: What is the SQL command to delete a column from a specific table?
quizData.answer: ALTER TABLE table_name DROP COLUMN column;
choices: ALTER TABLE table_name DROP COLUMN column;

quizData.question: What is the SQL command to modify a column in a specific table?
quizData.answer: ALTER TABLE table_name ALTER COLUMN column datatype;
choices: ALTER TABLE table_name ALTER COLUMN column datatype;
ALTER TABLE table_name ADD column datatype;

What SQL constraint ensures that all values in a column satisfy a specific condition upon creating a table?
What SQL constraint ensures that all values in a column of an existing table satisfy a specific condition?
What SQL constraint sets a default value for a column when there is no value specified upon creating a table?
What SQL constraint sets a default value for a column of an existing table when there is no value specified?

quizData.answer: Returns the sum of all values in a specified column.

quizData.question: What is the purpose of the GROUP BY clause in SQL?
quizData.answer: Used with aggregate functions to group the result-set by one or more columns.
choices: Assigns a temporary name to the column.
Performs a calculation on a set of values and returns a single value.
Used to restrict the output of a GROUP BY query by applying conditional criteria to the grouped rows.
Used with aggregate functions to group the result-set by one or more columns.

quizData.question: What is the syntax for the GROUP BY clause in SQL?
quizData.answer: SELECT columns FROM table_name GROUP BY columns;
choices: SELECT columns FROM table_name HAVING condition;
SELECT columns FROM table_name GROUP BY columns;
SELECT columns FROM table_name ORDER BY columns;
SELECT columns FROM table_name WHERE condition;

quizData.question: What is the purpose of the HAVING clause in SQL?
quizData.answer: Used to restrict the output of a GROUP BY query by applying conditional criteria to the grouped rows.
choices: Used with aggregate functions to group the result-set by one or more columns.
Assigns a temporary name to the column.
Performs a calculation on a set of values and returns a single value.
Used to restrict the output of a GROUP BY query by applying conditional criteria to the grouped rows.

quizData.question: What is the syntax for the HAVING clause in SQL?
quizData.answer: SELECT columns FROM table_name GROUP BY columns HAVING condition;
choices: SELECT columns FROM table_name GROUP BY columns;
SELECT columns FROM table_name HAVING condition;
SELECT columns FROM table_name ORDER BY columns;
SELECT columns FROM table_name WHERE condition;

quizData.question: What is the purpose of the ALIAS clause in SQL?

Assigns a temporary name to the column. It can also be given to tables.
Performs a calculation on a set of values and returns a single value.
Used to restrict the output of a GROUP BY query by applying conditional criteria to the grouped rows.

quizData.question: What is the syntax for the ALIAS clause in SQL?
quizData.answer: SELECT columns AS alias FROM table_name;
choices: SELECT columns FROM table_name GROUP BY columns;
SELECT columns AS alias FROM table_name;
SELECT columns FROM table_name ORDER BY columns;
SELECT columns FROM table_name WHERE condition;

quizData.question: What is the syntax for the TRIM function in SQL?
What does an INNER JOIN in SQL do?
quizData.answer: Returns rows that have matching values in both tables.
choices: Returns rows that have matching values in both tables.
Returns all rows from the left table and the matched records from the right table.
Returns all rows from the right table and the matched records from the left table.
Returns all records when there is a match on either the left or right table.

quizData.question: What is the syntax for an INNER JOIN in SQL?
quizData.answer: SELECT columns FROM table1 INNER JOIN table2 ON table1.column_name = table2.column_name;
choices: SELECT columns FROM table1 LEFT JOIN table2 ON table1.column_name = table2.column_name;
SELECT columns FROM table1 RIGHT JOIN table2 ON table1.column_name = table2.column_name;
SELECT columns FROM table1 INNER JOIN table2 ON table1.column_name = table2.column_name;
SELECT columns FROM table1 FULL OUTER JOIN table2 ON table1.column_name = table2.column_name;

quizData.question: What does a LEFT JOIN in SQL do?
quizData.answer: Returns all rows from the left table and the matched records from the right table. If there is no match from the right side, the result is NULL.
choices: Returns rows that have matching values in both tables.
Returns all rows from the left table and the matched records from the right table. If there is no match from the right side, the result is NULL.
Returns all rows from the right table and the matched records from the left table. If there is no match from the left side, the result is NULL.
Returns all records when there is a match on either the left or right table. If there is no match, the missing side will contain NULL.

quizData.question: What is the syntax for a LEFT JOIN in SQL?
quizData.answer: SELECT columns FROM table1 LEFT JOIN table2 ON table1.column_name = table2.column_name;
choices: SELECT columns FROM table1 LEFT JOIN table2 ON table1.column_name = table2.column_name;
SELECT columns FROM table1 RIGHT JOIN table2 ON table1.column_name = table2.column_name;
SELECT columns FROM table1 INNER JOIN table2 ON table1.column_name = table2.column_name;
SELECT columns FROM table1 FULL OUTER JOIN table2 ON table1.column_name = table2.column_name;

quizData.question: What does a RIGHT JOIN in SQL do?
quizData.answer: Returns all rows from the right table and the matched records from the left table. If there is no match from the left side, the result is NULL.
choices: Returns rows that have matching values in both tables.
Returns all rows from the left table and the matched records from the right table. If there is no match from the right side, the result is NULL.
Returns all rows from the right table and the matched records from the left table. If there is no match from the left side, the result is NULL.
Returns all records when there is a match on either the left or right table. If there is no match, the missing side will contain NULL.

quizData.question: What is the syntax for a RIGHT JOIN in SQL?
quizData.answer: SELECT columns FROM table1 RIGHT JOIN table2 ON table1.column_name = table2.column_name;
choices: SELECT columns FROM table1 LEFT JOIN table2 ON table1.column_name = table2.column_name;
SELECT columns FROM table1 RIGHT JOIN table2 ON table1.column_name = table2.column_name;
SELECT columns FROM table1 INNER JOIN table2 ON table1.column_name = table2.column_name;
SELECT columns FROM table1 FULL OUTER JOIN table2 ON table1.column_name = table2.column_name;

quizData.question: What does a FULL JOIN in SQL do?
quizData.answer: Returns all records when there is a match on either the left or right table. If there is no match, the missing side will contain NULL.
choices: Returns rows that have matching values in both tables.
Returns all rows from the left table and the matched records from the right table. If there is no match from the right side, the result is NULL.
Returns all rows from the right table and the matched records from the left table. If there is no match from the left side, the result is NULL.
Returns all records when there is a match on either the left or right table. If there is no match, the missing side will contain NULL.

quizData.question: What is the syntax for a FULL JOIN in SQL?
quizData.answer: SELECT columns FROM table1 FULL OUTER JOIN table2 ON table1.column_name = table2.column_name;
